channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump to hit Colombia with new tariffs amid clash with Petro over drug trade
item.description: President Trump said Sunday that the U.S. will slash aid to Colombia and slap new tariffs on the country, accusing its leader in a social media brawl ...

item.title: "Absolutely not": Witkoff, Kushner reject Gaza genocide claims in "60 Minutes" interview
item.description: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner discussed brokering a fragile deal between Israel and Hamas and rejected allegations that Israeli forces had committed...

item.title: What to know about the heist at Paris' Louvre museum
item.description: Paris' famous Louvre museum closed on Sunday after thieves brazenly stole priceless jewels in a daylight robbery. The big picture: The bandits made of...

item.title: YouTube crackdown, Trump's "big, beautiful bill" threaten future of gambling
item.description: Call it the war on poker — professional players and amateurs alike are coming under siege from Uncle Sam, YouTube and state regulators. Why it matters...

item.title: Behind the Curtain: It won't stop with Trump
item.description: President Trump and the federal government are policing speech, morality, and punishment of individual citizens at a level of micromanagement rarely, ...

item.title: George Santos, freed by Trump, says he wants to reform American prisons
item.description: “There is nothing more that I want to do than to focus and dedicate my entire life to prison reform,” Santos said.

item.title: Dangerous or life-saving? Why drug programs that stop disease are under fire.
item.description: A decade after a historic HIV outbreak in Indiana, syringe programs that helped contain the crisis are at risk of disappearing due to federal funding ...

item.title: The wealthy scientist on a mission to ensure California’s redistricting proposal fails
item.description: Meet Charles Munger Jr., the Stanford physicist and Berkshire Hathaway heir who’s spent tens of millions opposing California’s mid-decade redistrictin...

item.title: Why protesters against Trump are wearing frog, chicken and T. rex costumes
item.description: Democrats say the use of silly inflatable costumes is a way to undercut Republican portrayals of such events as violent “hate America rallies.”

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
